website_summaries.verdict: A versatile and bright light-laser combo sight that works well. The plastic mount, unfortunately, is not that durable.
pros: Combines a 125-lumens LED light with a red laser
Modes include laser only, light only, or both together
cons: The rail mount here is made from plastic and can break easily
Some buyers report that this sight loses zero easily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light for full size H&K USP
customer_reviews.text: This light is exactly what you need to set up a H&K Full Sized USP for late night home use. To get it set up, the mount rocks on and fills the rail mount so that the light stays in place and doesn't slide or rattle around. I had no trouble adjusting the laser to match my sights. For indoors, the red laser is perfectly bright and the white light is maybe a bit much. I have a Surefire, I like this better. I love this light.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw causing it to break
customer_reviews.text: This gun light has a design flaw with part of the rail attachment being made of plastic. This breaks very easily with only hand tightening. I had two break within a year. The second one with less than 500 rounds through the pistol. It is not something you can count on on a defensive pistol. Luckly, the Streamlight warranty and customer service is excellent. They replaced both of them and the second time with a tlr-2 which is all metal.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size & Great compromise
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic on the Glock 17. Was debating if this would be enough light / laser. Definitely glad I saved the money over the TLR 2 HL. I love the size vs. barrel length. I'm still looking for a solid holster option. Laser is bright! Light is excellent. Size is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Spiritual Shooter

customer_reviews.title: A great light for a compact pistol.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great product. I have the TLR-4 mounted on a glock 19 and the fit is great. The light sticks out around 1/2 inch past the muzzle of the gun. The light is white and very bright, perhaps blindingly so. The laser is also good and bright. It's a really good buy and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: UCLAdam

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: First off the seller sent me the wrong model, I specifically requested the model that’s made for the HK USP, instead I received the standard rail model. The green laser isn’t very bright, on a sunny day you cannot see the laser on target at all, it total vanishes. The flashlight also isn’t very bright, I’m definitely disappointed in the whole package. I requested a return from the seller but during the Covid-19 outbreak I doubt I’ll be making any unnecessary trips to the UPS store to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Light's good, laser won't hold zero
customer_reviews.text: The light is good. The laser won't hold zero with more than rimfire level recoil. This laser fell off my bed onto a pillow when not mounted to my pistol and the zero shifted. The best this laser is good for is pie plate sized groups at 10 yards due to wandering point of aim. The group will be small but it will be in a different random part of the pie plate every time the laser gets jostled. You've got to reference the laser against the sights immediately prior to shooting and apply Kentucky windage to get any kind of consistency. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: Totally impressed with the simple install, I used a RED Bore-Laser to "meet"with the GREEN Laser at about 50 yards. Does exactly what I need, Light-Only, Light-Laser, Laser-only. The only thing I'm not Completely happy with was the missing e-clip install/removal tool, (sniffle). If you look hard enough, you can find a holster that'll fit an FNX-45-Tactical w/ TLR4 & the Trijicon RM06-C-700672 RMR Type 2 Adjustable LED Sight, 3.25 MOA Red Dot Reticle, black . Neptune Concealment Kydex Gun Holster for FN FNX 45 Full Size - Light/Laser bearing Nestor Series - Veteran Made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 2

customer_reviews.title: Have had it for 8 years and still works fine but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 8 years. Purchased this item on June 2012. The battery life is excellent. Only issue is i now went to adjust the laser and the allen screws no longer turn. The allen wrench just spins like the allen screw is stripped, so basically my laser is a few inches below the aim of the gun UPDATE 10-1-20 I shipped the laser/light to Streamlight in PA. Less than 6 days later i received it back and was working like new. Also received a new battery with the laser
customer_reviews.author: Armando Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Fundamental design flaw on clamp. Broke for second time.
customer_reviews.text: This, as others have mentioned, has a fundamental design flaw in that the plastic clamp that holds it on is not strong enough. If you set it just enough to keep it stable when firing it will most likely fatigue off. My second one failed just sitting in the safe! I'm a mechanical engineer and not an idiot. I didn't put this thing on that tight. I don't have time to keep sending it back. Going elsewhere, never coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bass

customer_reviews.title: WTF, Streamlight? I thought you were a reputable company.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. Rail mount appears to be made of Chinesium, or possibly compressed oatmeal. It couldn't even survive shipping, much less mounting to a service handgun, much less possessing the kind of durability one would stake one's life on. I expected a metal mounting clamp, like on my TLR-1. This has one metal side, and another molded out of the plastic case. I will return this and buy a Surefire. WTF, Streamlight? I thought you were a reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Does not last get one with metal rails.
customer_reviews.text: After about 500 rounds plastic side rail broke. Did not over tighten, just fell off after 3 rounds. Granted I bought it 4 years ago but should last longer than 500 rounds. Very poor design using plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Yokasta Schneider

customer_reviews.title: looks great but serious design flaw in rail mount
customer_reviews.text: rail mount was broken out of the box. one side is metal, the other is the same plastic material as body of sight plastic side is way too thin and either is a molding issue defect that was not caught in quality control, or a repackaged defective unit. Not sure if I will try another one.
customer_reviews.author: bill irwin

customer_reviews.title: More than enough light for the job.
customer_reviews.text: After buying 2 tlr1-hl units for me quality wasn't the question. However being a lumen nut and having night blindness issues I wondered if 110 lumens were enough..... After a interesting bump outside the house I discovered it's the quality of the light it puts out that makes it a easy buy. My wife loves it and the laser is a bonus. Very well built and now have 5 surefire lights total. No question the best I have ever owned, surpassed surefire a long time ago for me. My wife has it on her Springfield Xds and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shane M

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this light to be used on a heavily used ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August of 2017. Pistol has about 50-100 rounds through it with light mounted. Mostly a nightstand firearm, lite duty only taken out at night if walking around property. Rarely fired. Mount broke at attachment point on left side. I would not recommend this light to be used on a heavily used firearm. The mount is too suspect. I contacted Streemlight and they have a pretty good warranty policy. I will be asking to upgrade to the TLR-2 (aluminum mount). I just can't trust the plastic mount on the TLR-4. =/
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Bright, Solid, Stays on Target
customer_reviews.text: Have a total of 3 of these Streamlights - some with the laser/light combo, others with just the lights. Rock solid after many rounds. Good battery life. Bright out to 25 yards. Like the continuous Light+Laser, Light or Laser combinations, including the associated momentary features. Laser has stayed put after 500 rounds on a Glock 19. Use a Streamlight on my Ruger 22 - what a great way to rid the yard of raccoons, possums and nuance squirrels at dusk and in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Having searched high and low for the perfect weapon light, I found it. The TLR-8G but the price was too high for me. So I searched some more and decided the TLR-4 was perfect for my price range. The construction is durable, and I’ve not had it fall off of my pistol. The instructions are quite clear on how to set it up for the different pistols. The light is bright and laser is visible during the day and at night.
customer_reviews.author: A Korean

customer_reviews.title: Fits well on my Glock 19 Gen 4. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well on my Glock 19 Gen 4. The flashlight is not too dim or too bright and makes it ideal for home defense. The green laser is bright and visible with the flashlight. The position of the switch is just slightly too far making it uncomfortable and requires getting used to. UPDATE: This is now on my M&P 9. Just noticed last week that the battery is about to tie. That means a single battery lasted me almost 5 years. Granted, I didnt use it everyday, but Im pretty impressed with the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this light!
customer_reviews.text: Bright, quick and ez install. Super ez to adjust laser. Stream light lives up to it’s reputation. I own two of these. I bought my first one in 2012 and no joke, same battery still works perfect (I should probably replace though). Obviously I don’t pull it out every night to use, but it’s good to know that if and when I need to use it (home defense pistol) i can rely on it working. Highly highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit on my Glock 21
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on my Glock 21 flush, I have long fingers and indexes on the switch right on the money. C clip was kind of a pain to insert dropped my first one that I found on the floor a day later but came with 2. Flashlight is bright enough to light up my house when things go bump in the night. I have not put it through the ringer yet but have been thought a box of ammo with it on and it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: rusticcomfort

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for my SIG P226 TACOPS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Sig Sauer P226 TACOPS 15 months. I've put over 3K rounds at the range and countless dry fire drills in low light conditions. This is a great light+laser! The green laser is very bright, even with the light on at 10+ yards. I bought a laser bore sight to zero it once and it hasn't budged at all; even after dozens and dozens cleanings. I recently lent it out for someone else to try it on their gun, and realized I had lost the hex driver. Q&A section here didn't answer the question on hex size. To adjust the laser, you'll need a 1/16 hex. Overall; VERY pleased this this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Larson

customer_reviews.title: Clamp broke on solid frame side.
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this light... EXCEPT that if you under-tighten it, after repeated rounds downrange, it moves. I gradually tightened in small increments until it no longer moved. Then one day I picked the weapon up from it's case and the clamp was broken. And it was broken on the fixed position side, not the adjustable side, so I can't replace the piece and fix it. The whole light is junk now. Streamlight should consider making both sides of the clamp replaceable, instead of one side being a part of the entire housing. I've never had this problem with Surefire lights and I've put them through hell. But they are more expensive... I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: R.Barbetta

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality clamp attachment
customer_reviews.text: Great light but plastic clamp broke while shooting after only 6 months. UPDATE: Had a replacement sent to me by Streamlight, but that one also broke in the same place on the clamp. This time, it was not in use but sitting in the safe. I took it out to clean it and noticed the light was loose. Upon closer inspection, I realized the clamp had broken again.
customer_reviews.author: vdawg

customer_reviews.title: Fell off my gun after a few years
customer_reviews.text: Product worked just fine on my Sig P226 Tacops until one day it fell off the gun at the range (before firing). Turns out the part that clips onto the rail cracked (not the part that can be removed, but just above the screw head attachment). I had only taken it off maybe 10-12 times in several years and tightened the screw with a coin. Guess you can only tighten so much, but you sure don’t want it to wiggle or fall off in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Love it. fit my full size usp45 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Love it. fit my full size usp45 perfectly... switches are in the perfect spot to operate with my trigger finger or weak hand thumb. i wish the laser was closer to the barrel for constancy of aim point, but its not like this laser is going to be used outside of 20 yards. light is plenty bright for indoor use, and easily illuminates an object 40 yards away well enough to identify the target.
customer_reviews.author: wezzz

customer_reviews.title: High quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on my Glock 21 gen 4 and my FNX-45. Very easy, I had the key changed and had it attached to my Glock within 5 minutes of opening the package. The light is bright and the laser is very clear. It’s made very well, pretty much all metal and the switches feel very nice, not like some cheap junk. I was skeptical about the quality vs price but you’re definitely getting what you pay for, I might buy a second one so I can have one on each of my guns.
customer_reviews.author: Turner S

customer_reviews.title: Quality control
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered this, and it just arrived today via USP. I used the light which worked very well, but when I went to switch the laser on nothing happened. I read similar customer reviews who experienced the same issue. I will however return and reorder this laser/light combo. Hopefully I'll get one that works
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for a nightstand gun, won't fit most holsters
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate, selector switch allows light-only, laser-only, or simultaneous operation. Mounted on Springfield XD, paddle switch is well within reach of my trigger finger. Be aware of the fact that the laser is about 2" below the barrel, if you zero it at a short distance such as 3-4 yards, the dot will show about 12"-18" high at 10-12 yards (I suck at geometry, feel free to correct my guesstimate). Consider zeroing at a longer distance and making a mental adjustment at shorter ranges. Honestly in a stressful shooting situation an indicated point-of-aim that's less than 2" off is probably not going to make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Stewbacca

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Power went out last night we are the last house on the hill in the country pretty scary. 4 kids and a scared wife. So u took this out because we didn't have the flashlights. And this was not mounted on my gun at the time. I was only using as a flash light. It would light up what ever rooms where exposed to the point it looked like sunrise. Very good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Rex

customer_reviews.title: Home defence concidoration
customer_reviews.text: Nice product! Lots of fun to shoot with. I believe this is a useful tool for home defense! In many cases the use of a light may not always be the best choice however with children in the house making a 100% positive identification of the target is a imperative. The additional use of the laser not only makes for increased rapid target acquisition but also has the advantage of increased certainty that rounds sent are more likely to be on target as apposed to straying into the background. The intimidation factor may also play in diminishing the probably that deadly force will be needed. My thoughts, hope they are of help!
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Compact enough to fit Walther P22
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a light/laser combo that was compact enough to fit the Walther P22, but wanted to stay with one of the major weapon light brands...this TLR-4 worked perfectly. I'm extremely happy with the fitment.
customer_reviews.author: iQUISMO

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime warranty!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my bedside Glock 9mm. What a bargain. Might not be as durable as Streamlight's more expensive models, but it served me well for 15 years!! When the toggle switch failed this year, they sent me a new one!!
customer_reviews.author: TheLastHousewife

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rail accessory for Glock 19
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this rail light/laser combo for my Glock 19 gen 3 over the others on the market, because I really liked and have had good experience with the Streamlight tactical flashlights. This is a great rail accessory, and is well made like the other Streamlight products I have purchased in the past. The flashlight is really bright and the red laser is nice and bright as well. Mounts right up to the rail with the supplied rail adapter and is a nice snug fit, and is easily removed when not needed. Very satisfied with this purchase and worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: This little light is a heck of a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well built, very bright, compact weapon light that mounts solidly to my Gen3 Glock rail. I didn't think the red laser sight would be very helpful but now that I have it I'm glad I paid a little extra for it. The small lever for activating the light and laser really should be a little longer to provide better leverage. I have quite large strong hands but find it difficult and a bit painful to lock the lever into the constant ON setting, especially the down lock. As an owner of multiple Surefire and Streamlight products I always prefer Surefire quality but Streamlight also builds very high quality products and neither brand has ever failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the ability to toggle switch between laser only
customer_reviews.text: Fits with XD 9mm quite well. No problems after my first time at the range, with over 130 rounds. I like the ability to toggle switch between laser only, light only, or both. Very good addition for home defense, as the laser display can be intimidating and it can help with aim during the nighttime. Of course, I practice without the laser as well, relying on the built in dove tail sights of the 9mm pistol. I bought extra streamlight batteries as spare, although the battery appears to last long if just using the laser.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Great for home defense gun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nightstand P320. It seems to work well but I had to tighten the crap out of the bolt. Even with the correct adapter it still felt a bit loose I cranked it down and it feels good now. At the range it worked as one would expect. I wouldn’t recommend it for edc but for a home defense piece yes
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Decent overall value for a combo light/laser from a reputable ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent overall value for a combo light/laser from a reputable company, functions well, red laser is bright and visible even in a brightly lit room, however the 125 lumen flashlight just left me underwhelmed with it's lack of brightness. I returned it and guess I'll have to pony up another hundred (or 2) for one of their higher end models. (TLR-2 or 8)
customer_reviews.author: Josh O.

customer_reviews.title: A little larger than I had hoped but pleased with operation.
customer_reviews.text: A little larger than I was expecting, but fit perfectly on my Glock 41. If you are really anal about looks, you might find this a little bulky. I believe that the size is due to the battery used. (123) I do not mind because the unit works better than I had hope. The laser actually was visible at over a hundred yards, although I am not planning to shot that far out. The light is bright and quickly widens out for good lumination of a large area. (Flood rather than spot)
customer_reviews.author: rjhansen63

customer_reviews.title: Bad mounting system.
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone else the plastic side of the mount cracked.. everything on it works great except the mounting system.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Wisemore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome weapons light!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light for a FNH FNX40 .40 cal pistol for home defense and it is awesome. I decided to purchase from Amazon due to their competitive price and return policy in case I was not satisfied. Pros: The weapon light is well built with a aluminium light head. Lightweight Small size. Price. Simple switch design. Simple to use in the dark Cons: To lock the laser/light switch on you must push the lever down on the right side. It should have been ambidextrous with the same features on both sides. Recommended: Yes. For the price this was a great purchase. This weapons light met my price point for it's needs with home defense.
customer_reviews.author: 2015 4Runner Trail POV

customer_reviews.title: Bright and compact!!!
customer_reviews.text: Light is bright. Its bright enough to confuse and irritate the intruder. I tried looking into the light at about 20 - 40 feet away and it hurt my eyes...made me squint and turn away...kind of like staring at the sun for a second...leaves an imprint in your vision for several seconds if not longer. Its a white LED light...and it has a good focus beam with a good flooding of peripheral lighting. Its also affordable...not too expensive. It fits nice and snug. After a few practice rounds, it did not come loose...which is exactly what it should do. I feel it was a good buy. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Sig P320 Carry
customer_reviews.text: GREAT addition to my P320 Carry. Fairly easy to mount. Have not fired gun yet but mount seems very secure. Controls are perfectly positioned for both trigger finger or support hand. Crisp control feel. Light seems much brighter than 125 lumens, more than sufficient for home defense. Front of light protrudes approximately 3/8" past muzzle. I recommend without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: David in Va

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my purchase.. such a great laser/light comb... good quality I have it mounted on my XD40 and it fits perfect... it comes with several adapters for variety of handguns. honestly for the price its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great light/laser combo
customer_reviews.text: Great accessory for my Springfield XD .45 compact. The light is very bright and the laser is great once you sight it in at the range. It did break a year after I bought it. I was taking it out of my leg holster when the part that attaches to the rail system broke off (not the adjustable rail, the other side). So it couldn't attach to the pistol after that. I contacted Streamlight and had me send it in and they couldn't fix it and ended up sending me a brand new one, free of charge! Only cost me the shipping to send in the broken one. I'd definitely buy another Streamlight product.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: Bright light!  Laser has no end!
customer_reviews.text: Very bright light for it's size. Unlike flashlights that have a broad so-so beam, this one has a broad beam that really lights up a huge area. It also is brighter in the center of the beam(about a 6ft radius). This really lights up what you need to see, along with the area around it. I have an average back yard....this little thing lit it up like I couldn't believe! The laser is really great too. I don't know the distance on the laser, but it showed solid on everything I pointed it at(longest was about 70 yards). It's a bit big for a compact 9mm, but good for a normal sized .45 cal .
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Price jumped 40 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Great light & laser the reason for three stars is was going to by another but price jumped up 40 dollars,bought it on another site for 5 dollars more than original
customer_reviews.author: darryl tuc az

customer_reviews.title: Laser is easy to center with provided allen wrench
customer_reviews.text: Light and laser are very bright. Laser is easy to center with provided allen wrench. I have this mounted on a G30S so the light sticks out a little, which i expected and am fine with. What i don't like, is that the exhaust fumes from firing stains the flashlight lens very easy. After about 100 bullets, i had to scrub it with a cleaning wipe and gun cleaner for almost an hour. I think next time, i will be putting some sort of tape of the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Popped it right on and it works great. Works with Light and laser, or Light only, or Laser only. Hold lever for on, let go for off. Or push opposite side to keep light/laser on.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Easy, flush, solid. Very bright. Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this was easy to install on my Sig P-320C. Sits flush, rocker switch in easy reach, extremely, blindingly bright. Laser is clearly visible. I don't have many rounds through the gun with this installed yet, but I'll update if there's a problem. Otherwise, seems to be a very high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Freaking fantastic light and laser
customer_reviews.text: Freaking fantastic light and laser! VERY bright light! Installs with ease and the laser adjustment is very easy. You can use light, laser or both. The swivel on/off knob is very easily reached with an extended finger. rotates both up or down to turn on and the spring tension on it is perfect. This turns my glock into an intimidating home defense weapon. Boosts your confidence as a shooter and deters your enemy with ease. There's no question to someone with a laser on their chest as to whether or not you're a good shot.
customer_reviews.author: BigSpender

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: i just love my light. 3 modes to choose from between laser, LED, or both LED & laser. easy to install. for glock 23 i used the C key. i noticed after shooting at the range the lens gets covered in GSR, but it easily cleans off and looks good as new. the good thing was the light still shines brightly through even when it was coated after 100 rounds. still looking for a great holster to accomodate the light since i don't want to be taking it on and off. i definitely recommend this to anyone who has a glock that wants some light for night defense.
customer_reviews.author: luckyguy73

customer_reviews.title: This should be made of a more sturdy material as you will want to remove it every ...
customer_reviews.text: After only 7 weeks of owning, the plastic rail clamp has proved to be not very durable and is breaking. I've not abused it (700 rounds fired using it) and now the stationary side of the plastic clamp is breaking. This should be made of a more sturdy material as you will want to remove it every time you clean your weapon. The accuracy of the TLR 4 is spot on, providing you can return it to original position after reassembly.
customer_reviews.author: REVBC

customer_reviews.title: Great for home defense
customer_reviews.text: This is a great home defense tool. Somehow I failed to realize that the one I ordered only came configured with a clamp for a Sig. Emailed Streamlight though and they sent me a selection of the "keys" needed to use it on other guns. Great product and great service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product, disappointed in streamlight for accessories
customer_reviews.text: Great light for a great price. Awesome that it has a laser built in that holds zero on my 1911. Liked it so much, wanted to buy a TLR for my AR15s. Saw the light at a great price. Saw a rifle kit at a great price. Saw a battery door that you need to put on to marry the light to the rifle kit... $50. For one piece. Of plastic. Disappointed in that. Took the overall price from a great deal to same price range as higher end illumination devices. Why buy the TLR at that point?
customer_reviews.author: Steve Biedrzycki

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Fits my old HK USP compact. Easy to install, easy to use. Mine has the green laser and the flashlight. Both are amazing. Exactly what's needed for home defense in the dark when you are sick and tired of trying to hold a flashlight in your weak hand.
customer_reviews.author: army

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory for a compact firearm.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Glock 17 well. Doesn't add very much weight and doesn't throw off the balance. The light is plenty bright and though not as bright as their full size model it's what you'd expect it to be for a compact. I would give it a perfect five stars if the laser held zero a little better after being fired, it's not drastic but noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money with cheap imitations.
customer_reviews.text: After picking up a new 9mm I was looking for a light laser combo and was surprised by all the cheap knock offs on the market now days. Don't even bother with them! This Streamlight unit is amazingly well built, has a very small foot print and can really light up a room at night. I have this mounted on PPS, which is a very small 9mm, and was initially worried about the light looking massive and out of place but this light looks like it was made for that gun! I imagine it will look just as good on any compact pistol and you really get a quality piece of hardware you can be proud of.
customer_reviews.author: Goat Rope Garage

customer_reviews.title: Yes sir this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Everyone mentions how the height adjustment can become stripped very easy. I did not try to adjust it with the key it came with, as most people suggested the metal strips it, so I consulted the tool box and found one that fit just fine. Don't have a problem. I prefer the compact version. (that is to say, I like the 4 better than the 2.) It fits better with guns. I personally don't like a flashlight to stick out past the barrel, so this fits perfectly on my S&W M&P. Easily mounts and unmounts, and is secure so it doesn't get loose while firing.
customer_reviews.author: mattyhanks

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my .40 Sig Sauer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition for any pistol. The light easily attaches to my pistol and it seems like most other users agree. The switch has a really effective position just in front of the trigger where you can choose to select between light on, laser on, or both on. It can also easily be able to switched off and on for clearing rooms of your house. The piece is quality and it comes off very easily for the cleaning of my pistol and when I take it to the range. Yet when it is attached it is held in place very well. I would recommend it for anyone looking for a laser and/or flashlight for your pistol.
customer_reviews.author: Screaming Cinema

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and cheap
customer_reviews.text: This thing is only supposed to be just over 100 lumens but its brighter then my 300 lumen pocket flashlight. Solid construction, bright laser, bright flashlight. I use my gear hard in advanced practicals and this little guy has seen its drops and bangs. Holds up as well as more expensive brands. If you don't want the most expensive, but don't want the cheapist either then this is the light you want. Only thing I wish it would do is strobe.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Works well on TP9SA
customer_reviews.text: I dropped this on my Canik TP9SA without any issues. The light is plenty bright and the laser appears to hold it’s zero. Everything needed to install it came in the package.
customer_reviews.author: blueskye

customer_reviews.title: Fits VP9, streamlight quality
customer_reviews.text: This fit my VP9 rail well. 2 of the rail keys work; one very close to the trigger guard, one a bit further away. I chose the one that placed light switch at the end of the guard rather than overlapping it. Light is bright, laser as well. Just need to the range to see how well it holds zero.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too Bad of a Stretch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in December 2014,, and have used this ever since. Great light/laser for close/med range usage. I have it on a Glock 23 G-4. The only complaint is that on the Glock 23, the activation leavers do not reach along side the trigger guard. Being out in front of the trigger guard, it makes it more difficult to stretch your finger to activate the light/laser. I have a large hand, so I expected an easier reach. But I would still recommend this product for anyone with large hands. Definitely not for female/younger operators. I will install this on my Glock 21 G-3 to see if it makes any better reach. If so, I will update my review with that info.
customer_reviews.author: Keioni

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: A terrific light/laser. Includes inserts to adapt it to various pistols. The light output is great, giving complete confidence. And the laser is visible with the light on. I must admit I could not get the one received to vertically adjust (perhaps just me), but a call to the company had a replacement was on its way. To me, customer service always gets 5 stars. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Bug

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awesome invention known to man. No problems sighting in or installing. Not too big or bulky (on decent size handgun). Will light up a room without blinding you. Wish I could afford another 1. Update..... so after sighting in the laser, the gun sat for several months. Took it to the range and after about 2 shots the thing fell off my .45. The side mount plastic piece had broken. Contacted Amazon and had a new one in 3 business days, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Billy magnum

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my AR15 but knowing I could use it on my Glock 19 if I didn't like it on the AR. It worked great on the AR15. Mounted it as far up front as I could get it on the right hand side of the quad rail. Controls are easy to manage with the support hand while shooting. It is compact and light weight and does not add much weight up front. Light is nice and bright. Laser is easy to adjust. Only down side is it does not have a strobe function if you are looking for that feature. I plan to order another one for my hand guns.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyDriver

customer_reviews.title: Light stopped working after 300 rounds.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this - but it seems the bulb broke after about 300 rounds. They say no warranty on bulbs so I'm SOL.
customer_reviews.author: ICD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the most high quality/low cost professional grade laser/flashlight combos out there. Buttons are easily accessible from the trigger area and the flashlight is blindingly bright. Sticks out quite a bit beyond the barrel of my sub compact Springfield 9mm but makes no difference at all!! Don't waste your money on the $20 rail lasers, spend a little more and get something that actually works and stays in place while shooting!! Now if I could just find a holster that will hold this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: ringer

customer_reviews.title: I guess I got Lucky.
customer_reviews.text: This laser/light combo is AWESOME, I wish I had gotten one for myself a long time a go. Easy to mount/remove. Mounting position seems easy enough to change with supplied adaptors(I did not need to change mine from the one that it had by default) Laser was very easy to adjust, I was a bit apprehensive due to all the negative reviews but my adjustment screws moved freely. It should be noted, It doesnt take very much to adjust the laser, the slightest turn changes of point of impact greatly. I love how bright the light is and the ability to change modes(laser only, light only, Both on) For the price, you really can't beat this handy gadget.
customer_reviews.author: T. Crihfield

customer_reviews.title: Light 'em up!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, something that I recommend to my students. More than sufficient for illumination / target designation in any size home. It's pretty much the standard in compact tactical illumination. Easy adjustments, just go slow as to not overdo it. Are there products out there that are cheaper? Sure. But, will they work as well as this one does? Probably not. Combine with a KT Tech holster, and you are set. For those wondering, I've also used this on AR15s and AK47s. Works fine on both platforms. Have one on my SBR and G17 full-time.
customer_reviews.author: Crusader Monk

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Home Defense
customer_reviews.text: I have had one for 2 years but my father just purchased a pistol and this will be a gift for him. Excellent quality and functionality. Bright light and easy to find laser. No issues with hundreds of rounds down range. Full adjustable for wind age and elevation. Can shoot right groups at 7 yards. Keeps your from fumbling around for a flashlight in the night. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and quality product, been using it for 2 years on a sig, and no issues. The light is bright and the laser comes through best in mid to low light situations. Intuitive controls and easy to zero in with any sidearm. If you want to add some tactical flare to your handgun without the hefty price tag, definitely pick this one up.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Streamlight TLR-4 TAC Light for Beretta 92A1
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Beretta 92A1. The light and laser are bright and easy to see. The laser adjustments are easy to make. The main reason I gave it only 4 stars was due to fitment issues. The crossbar on the adapter designated for my pistol required some filing to fit into slot on the rail. I'm not sure if it's a Beretta or Streamlight issue. Also the clamp seems to work loose after firing ( in my case 200 rnds. in one session at the range ). I'll just remember to check tightness more often.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and a great price. This is exactly what I was looking for to to put on my home defense pistol (Sig P320 Full Size) It will fit a wide variety of pistols with the included adaptors. Nice, sleek, compact design. Bright laser that is easy to adjust and is spot on. Stands up to recoils no problem without having to make any adjustments. Flashlight is very bright and will illuminate anything you need it to. Just as good if not better than some of the more expensive ones out there. Will be purchasing more in the future. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee and Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Breaks
customer_reviews.text: Breaks even when not shooting. Warrantied twice for same issue. 3rd time I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Roganator

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to my XD9 subcompact!
customer_reviews.text: Fit my XD9 perfectly. Key "A" already installed; so it was just a matter of placing the light/laser on the rail and tightening it down. Laser required no zeroing; it was right on with just the installation on the pistol. I had bought a TruGlo light/laser combo originally. It did not fit well and popped off with the first round fired. It is now on my AR and works well; so no loss, just a different weapon.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Ronn

customer_reviews.title: otherwise its a great light and loved it right up until it fell ...
customer_reviews.text: has a design flaw. the clamp part has metal on one side and plastic on the other. so one day at the range it fell off. currently sending it off to streamlight for warranty. ill update when it gets resolved. otherwise its a great light and loved it right up until it fell off.
customer_reviews.author: MATT F VICTOR

customer_reviews.title: Great light/laser combo for my Sig Sauer P226
customer_reviews.text: Perfect compromise. I wanted a light and a laser to mount on my pistol rail but I didn't want to spend $500. This is a polymer model so it's lighter than I wanted but for the price, it's tough to beat! The light is plenty bright and the laser is spot on. The combination of light/laser uses is impressive and handy. Looks good on my Sig P226 Legion and, more importantly, works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Have to say am in love. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Wife got it instead of a red dot. Have to say am in love. Works great. Build very well. Bright light. Easy controls. Will buy another soon. Fits perfect on S.P. XDm9 3.8. FNS 9 and FNS 9c will need adjusting to different key. B, D, E keys work just fine but may not allow to be real close to trigger as other models. But still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nain-Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Put on a Colt 1911 after I realized one night that I had a gun and could see crap in the house. No issues, duel function.
customer_reviews.author: TheMayor

customer_reviews.title: Surprised and happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Gives out just enough light without being too blinding for the shooter. Laser works. Need to take it to the range to see how it holds up and zero it at the right distance. It's a good value/quality for someone looking for a laser/light combo for their primary home defense pistol.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla Edison

customer_reviews.title: Great pistol light
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light at a great price. It comes with different rail adapters. The light is bright enough and after 100rds of 9mm the lazer holds zero. Quick on and off the rail no problem. Only thing is my hellfighter rail mount light broke at the rail clamp and this lights rail clamp is plastic like that one so I hope is dosnt break at that point also.
customer_reviews.author: Lance M. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: This Streamlight TLR-4 is the heat for home protection use.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to set up another handgun for home defense purposes and saw this unit at a friends house. After careful review, I decided this would work out great. Mounted it on an Springfield XD-M .40 cal where it fit perfectly. The light is great inside the home and the ability to run the light and laser separately or together is a tactical plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. F. Fagan

customer_reviews.title: I Like
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on SW MP .40 cal. Good ergonomics and light is good and bright. Not as bright as my tactical streamlight flashlight but adequate. Make sure to read instructions and DO NOT OVER TIGHTEN THE BOLT (like I did).
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Best laser/light combo for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Best laser/light combo for the money. If you were looking for a laser/light combo, the TLR-4 is definitely worth considering. Pros: ~Light is bright enough but not overly bright. ~Laser is very visible at night. Cons: ~Kind of bulky when attached to a glock 19. ~The laser should be above the flashlight and not below for better precision.
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: Plastic clamp 👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of the TRL-4 and how it operates. The plastic construction of this light was the main problem for me. I was putting this light on a Glock 20 and it would not secure properly. No matter how much I tightened the screw, I could not completely eliminate all of the play. It might be alright for the light but the laser moved out of adjustment every time you picked up the gun. I even wonder if it would hold up to the 10mm's recoil. Sent it back for a TRL-1.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: It does what I hoped it would. All I wanted was to protect my house at night. After deciding I would never fire at anything further than 30' in my house, I went to the firing range & adjusted the laser for that range. It's comforting that I can pull my .45 from my night stand, take a two-handed grip, and with my trigger finger, flip on both the light & the laser at the same time. However, the laser does seem to present a double (or elongated) dot sometimes even when reflecting off a 90 degree surface. I'll figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Value - No Problems
customer_reviews.text: So could I have spent a lot more money and got a better light/laser ?...Probably BUT considering most of the higher end stuff is out of the range of my budget I went with this product instead. So far I am completely satisfied. The directions were satisfactory, It mounted easily/flawlessly and it works perfectly. So far I really haven't messed around with trying to sight in the laser any better than it was right out of the box...as it is it's maybe two or three inches off at 25 yards, so I figure why worry about it.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie P

customer_reviews.title: I see you!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tactical light. Comes out of the box ready to install on many platforms. Simple instructions. The three function switch at the bottom allows for laser only light only or both. The on/off switch is easy operating and can be pushed the other way for momentary use. Nice tight fit to my glock 22. I recommend some range time with the light installed as it does change the balance of weapon. Great job Streamlight!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Wester

customer_reviews.title: No issues with this!!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the cheap package and right on the rail. Packaging did not suit the quality of the product, so don't be surprised if you feel you got more than your initial opinion. Mounted to my CZ P-07 Duty semi-auto, fits perfect and looks like it belongs as O.E.M.! Bright white LED flash-lite, and red laser, made my pistol tactical, and supreme for home defense. No weight issues, no mounting issues, no zeroing issues, no switching on-off-both, momentary, and steady-on issues! If you can't figure out the proper use of this, then you should not handle a weapon! It may not be suitable for military use, but for the average gun owner, the TLR-4 is highly recommended, period!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt move
customer_reviews.text: This laser/light is Great. I shot a ton of rounds with it on my 40cal and it never moved once
customer_reviews.author: SolarPanelB

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on one of my FNS9C .. I’ve been practicing with it and wasn’t always crazy about having a light and laser on my edc. Now I’m most likely going to buy another one for my edc.. The non constant feature just being able to have it on for an instant is most important to me.
customer_reviews.author: Savage9999

customer_reviews.title: Great light / laser combo for full size pistol
customer_reviews.text: Super bright flashlight and laser was almost perfectly straight out of the box. I have this on my Beretta 92A1 (M9). It fits the gun great and hasn't moved with over 1000 rounds fired.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: As many will see with this light/laser, there are many complaints about the laser adjustment screws stripping. After mounting this yesterday and sighting in the laser, I saw no way those adjustments can be stripped. If you put the supplied allen wrench in all the way and not use an 18v dewalt, you will be successful in zeroing in that laser. There are many lights that are brighter but this is very sufficient in lighting up my house and hallways. Don't wait, but it.
customer_reviews.author: ZahnZahn

customer_reviews.title: Mount broke after one short.  Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic clamp broke after firing one shot (9mm). Unit flew off the gun and the range master had to call a "cease fire" while I went to retrieve it. I have no confidence in this product and replaced with another brand. Failed clamp has been reported by at least on other reviewer. Seems to be the luck of the draw and I suspect sooner or later more than a few are going to experience. Not a confidence builder. Spend more, get more in this case. Most reviews here were made soon after purchasing not after extended usage.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: A very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted to my 9mm pistol. Great for a home defense pistol, Easy to turn on the light and or laser. It lights up a large area, excellent for in home and good for outside if needed. It's my first laser, but I'm really liking it. Aim it the same but use the laser as my guide now. It sighted in well and is accurate for the range I have it set up at.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Possible issues with laser?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is because this is new, but I seem to be having a problem with the laser holding zero. I'll update this review as I discover more. I've had to adjust it twice now... Not sure what is going on. Overall, the light is bright, and despite what some users say, I am able to see the laser during the day. It's obviously nowhere near as visible as at night, but I really question the value of a laser anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great product. For my Canik TP9SA I used key ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. For my Canik TP9SA I used key F so the gun would sit back as far as possible to limit the blow back from the entering The light cap. FYI there's a washer and a remover tool. I don't think you have to use it but I know it makes taking the light on and off easier. I'll add a pic of it as well
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Decent price for a more than decent product. If green laser seems too expensive then this 1 is the next best thing. Sort of too big for my rail attachment holster and gets snagged on the inside of my pants when drawing sometimes but it's a great laser/flashlight attachment for home defense.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hunt

customer_reviews.title: One nice bit of battle rifle equipment
customer_reviews.text: One nice bit of battle rifle equipment. Compact and functions well. Saw some complaints in reviews but survived a tour of duty and keeps your weapon low profile in tight places. I like it! Better than some issue gear with a much higher footprint that catch on everything. Does the same job as NSN issue.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Ladner

customer_reviews.title: Yup, just go ahead and buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Ruger SR45....perfect fit on the bottom rail, can light up dark areas quite brightly now with the light-only function, easily switch to laser only- or have both light and laser on at same time. Can't beat it for the price! Took to gun range for practice and no issues whatsoever with it coming loose, etc...and I was able to mount/install it literally within a minute. Definitely recommend- great deal for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eswil1

product_meta.title: Streamlight 69240 TLR-4 Compact Rail Mounted Tactical Light with Laser Sight - 125 Lumens, Black

The light provides 1.5 hours of continuous runtime when in dual mode with the high power visible laser. Rail clamp designed to rapidly attach/detach from side of weapon. Case body is made from impact resistant Engineering polymer. Face cap is made using 6000 series machined aircraft aluminum with black anodized finish. Borofloat high temperature glass lens. Light source uses C4 LED technology, impervious to shock with a 50,000 hour lifetime. 5,000 c and ela peak beam intensity and 110 lumens measured system output. Textured parabolic reflector produces a concentrated beam with optimum peripheral illumination. 640 660nm red laser provides long range targeting. Optimized electronics provide regulated intensity. Ambidextrous momentary/steady On Off switch. Three position Mode Selector switch for Laser only, LED illumination only or both Laser and LED. Run time is 1.5 hours regulated run time to the 10 percent output level for LED only or LED and Laser. Run time is 11 hours regulated output for Laser only. Securely fits a broad range of weapons using key kit provided.
